member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.ProjectedFileSystemProvider.EnumerateItems(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Enumerates the item under the relative path.
member.param: A string specifying the path, relative to the virtualization root, to the file or directory to be deleted.

Gets the search expression. The search expression may include wildcard characters. The provider should use the ProjectedFileSystem's DoesNameContainWildCards function to determine whether wildcards are present in searchExpression, and it should use the DoesFileNameMatch function to determine whether an entry in its backing store matches a search expression containing wildcards.
member.returns: A list of items corresponding to the input arguments.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFICATION
member.summary: A notification value specified when sending the notification in a callback. Maps to Windows' PRJ_NOTIFICATION enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFICATION.PRJ_NOTIFICATION_FILE_OPENED
member.summary: If received in a notification: indicates that a handle has been created to an existing file or folder, the provider can specify a new notification mask for this file or folder when responding to the notification. If specified on virtualization instance start: indicates that the provider should be notified when a handle is created to an existing file or folder. If specified in response to a notification: indicates that the provider should be notified if any further handles are created to the file or folder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFICATION.PRJ_NOTIFICATION_NEW_FILE_CREATED
member.summary: If received in a notification: a new file or folder has been created, the provider can specify a new notification mask for this file or folder when responding to the notification. If specified on virtualization instance start: the provider should be notified when a new file or folder is created. If specified in response to a notification: no effect.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFICATION.PRJ_NOTIFICATION_FILE_OVERWRITTEN
member.summary: If received in a notification: an existing file has been overwritten or superceded, the provider can specify a new notification mask for this file or folder when responding to the notification. If specified on virtualization instance start: indicates that the provider should be notified when an existing when an existing file is overwritten or superceded. If specified in response to a notification: indicates that the provider should be notified when the file or folder is overwritten or superceded.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFICATION.PRJ_NOTIFICATION_PRE_DELETE
member.summary: If received in a notification: a file or folder is about to be deleted. If the provider returns an error code from the callback, the delete will not take effect. If specified on virtualization instance start: indicates that the provider should be notified when a file or folder is about to be deleted. If specified in response to a notification: indicates that the provider should be notified when a file or folder is about to be deleted.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFICATION.PRJ_NOTIFICATION_PRE_RENAME
member.summary: If received in a notification: a file or folder is about to be renamed. If the provider returns an error code from the callback, the rename will not take effect. If specified on virtualization instance start: indicates that the provider should be notified when a file or folder is about to be renamed. If specified in response to a notification: indicates that the provider should be notified when a file or folder is about to be renamed.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFICATION.PRJ_NOTIFICATION_PRE_SET_HARDLINK
member.summary: If received in a notification: a hard link is about to be created for the file. If the provider returns an error code from the callback, the hard link operation will not take effect. If specified on virtualization instance start: indicates that the provider should be notified when a hard link is about to be created for a file. If specified in response to a notification: indicates that the provider should be notified when a hard link is about to be created for a file.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFICATION.PRJ_NOTIFICATION_FILE_RENAMED
member.summary: If received in a notification: indicates that a file/folder has been renamed. The file/folder may have been moved into the virtualization instance. If specified on virtualization instance start: indicates that the provider should be notified that a file or folder has been renamed. If specified in response to a notification: indicates that the provider should be notified when a file or folder has been renamed.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFICATION.PRJ_NOTIFICATION_HARDLINK_CREATED
member.summary: If received in a notification: indicates that a hard link has been created for the file. If specified on virtualization instance start: indicates that the provider should be notified that a hard link has been created for a file. If specified in response to a notification: indicates that the provider should be notified that a hard link has been created for the file.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFICATION.PRJ_NOTIFICATION_FILE_HANDLE_CLOSED_NO_MODIFICATION
member.summary: If received in a notification: a handle has been closed on the file/folder, and the files content was not modified while the handle was open, and the file/folder was not deleted If specified on virtualization instance start: yhe provider should be notified when a handle is closed on a file/folder and the closing handle neither modified nor deleted it. If specified in response to a notification: yhe provider should be notified when handles are closed for the file/folder and there were no modifications or deletions associated with the closing handle.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFICATION.PRJ_NOTIFICATION_FILE_HANDLE_CLOSED_FILE_MODIFIED
member.summary: If received in a notification: a handle has been closed on the file, and that the files content was modified while the handle was open. If specified on virtualization instance start: the provider should be notified when a handle is closed on a file/folder and the closing handle was used to modify it. If specified in response to a notification: the provider should be notified when a handle is closed on the file/folder and the closing handle was used to modify it.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFICATION.PRJ_NOTIFICATION_FILE_HANDLE_CLOSED_FILE_DELETED
member.summary: If received in a notification: a handle has been closed on the file/folder, and that it was deleted as part of closing the handle. If specified on virtualization instance start: the provider should be notified when a handle is closed on a file/folder and it is deleted as part of closing the handle. If specified in response to a notification: the provider should be notified when a handle is closed on the file/folder and it is deleted as part of closing the handle.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFICATION.PRJ_NOTIFICATION_FILE_PRE_CONVERT_TO_FULL
member.summary: If received in a notification: the file is about to be expanded from a placeholder to a full file, i.e. its contents are likely to be modified. If the provider returns an error code from the callback, the file will not be expanded to a full file, and the I/O that triggered the conversion will fail. If there are multiple racing I/Os that would expand the same file, the provider will receive this notification value only once for the file. If specified on virtualization instance start: the provider should be notified when it is about to convert a placeholder to a full file. If specified in response to a notification: the provider should be notified when it is about to convert the placeholder to a full file, assuming it is a placeholder and not already a full file.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFY_TYPES
member.summary: Types of notifications describing a change to the file or folder. Maps to Windows' PRJ_NOTIFICATION enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFY_TYPES.PRJ_NOTIFY_NONE
member.summary: No notification.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFY_TYPES.PRJ_NOTIFY_SUPPRESS_NOTIFICATIONS
member.summary: If received in a notification: this notification value is not sent. If specified on virtualization instance start: indicates that notifications should not be sent for the virtualization instance, or a specified subtree of the instance. If specified in response to a notification: indicates that notifications should not be sent for the specified file or folder until all handles to it are closed.

member.summary: If received in a notification: indicates that a handle has been created to an existing file or folder, the provider can specify a new notification mask for this file or folder when responding to the notification. If specified on virtualization instance start: indicates that the provider should be notified when a handle is created to an existing file or folder. If specified in response to a notification: indicates that the provider should be notified if any further handles are created to the file or folder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFY_TYPES.PRJ_NOTIFY_NEW_FILE_CREATED
member.summary: If received in a notification: a new file or folder has been created, the provider can specify a new notification mask for this file or folder when responding to the notification. member.summary: If received in a notification: this notification is not sent by the API. If specified on virtualization instance start: this value is not valid on virtualization instance start. If specified in response to a notification: continue to use the existing set of notifications for this file/folder.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_STARTVIRTUALIZING_FLAGS
member.summary: Flags to provide when starting a virtualization instance. Maps to Windows' PRJ_STARTVIRTUALIZING_FLAGS enumeration..

member.summary: No flags.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_STARTVIRTUALIZING_FLAGS.PRJ_FLAG_USE_NEGATIVE_PATH_CACHE
member.summary: Specifies that ProjFS should maintain a "negative path cache" for the virtualization instance.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_FAILURE_CAUSES
member.summary: Descriptions for the reason an update failed. Maps to Windows' PRJ_UPDATE_FAILURE_CAUSES enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_FAILURE_CAUSES.PRJ_UPDATE_FAILURE_CAUSE_NONE
member.summary: The update did not fail.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_FAILURE_CAUSES.PRJ_UPDATE_FAILURE_CAUSE_DIRTY_METADATA
member.summary: The item was a dirty placeholder (hydrated or not), and the provider did not specify PRJ_UPDATE_ALLOW_DIRTY_METADATA in PRJ_UPDATE_TYPES.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_FAILURE_CAUSES.PRJ_UPDATE_FAILURE_CAUSE_DIRTY_DATA
member.summary: The item was a full file and the provider did not specify PRJ_UPDATE_ALLOW_DIRTY_DATA in PRJ_UPDATE_TYPES.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_FAILURE_CAUSES.PRJ_UPDATE_FAILURE_CAUSE_TOMBSTONE
member.summary: The item was a tombstone and the provider did not specify PRJ_UPDATE_ALLOW_TOMBSTONE in PRJ_UPDATE_TYPES.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_FAILURE_CAUSES.PRJ_UPDATE_FAILURE_CAUSE_READ_ONLY
member.summary: The item had the DOS read-only bit set and the provider did not specify PRJ_UPDATE_ALLOW_READ_ONLY in PRJ_UPDATE_TYPES.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_TYPES
member.summary: Flags to specify whether updates will be allowed given the state of a file or directory on disk. Maps to Windows' PRJ_UPDATE_TYPES enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_TYPES.PRJ_UPDATE_NONE
member.summary: Allow update only if the item is a placeholder (whether hydrated or not).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_TYPES.PRJ_UPDATE_ALLOW_DIRTY_METADATA
member.summary: Allow update if the item is a placeholder or a dirty placeholder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_TYPES.PRJ_UPDATE_ALLOW_DIRTY_DATA
member.summary: Allow update if the item is a placeholder or if it is a full file.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_TYPES.PRJ_UPDATE_ALLOW_TOMBSTONE
member.summary: Allow update if the item is a placeholder or if it is a tombstone.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_TYPES.PRJ_UPDATE_ALLOW_READ_ONLY
member.summary: Allow update regardless of whether the DOS read-only bit is set on the item.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.ProjectedFileSystem.DeleteFile(System.String,ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_TYPES,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables a provider to delete an item that has been cached on the local file system.
member.param: A string specifying the path, relative to the virtualization root, to the file or directory to be deleted.
Flags to control the delete operation should be allowed given the state of the file.
if set to true errors may be thrown otherwise the return value may be null.
member.returns: A value that describes the reason for the failure, if any.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.ProjectedFileSystem.UpdateFileIfNeeded(System.String,ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.ProjectedFileSystemItem,ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_TYPES,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables a provider to update an item that has been cached on the local file system.
member.param: A string specifying the path, relative to the virtualization root, to the file or directory to be updated.

The item to update. If the item's VersionInfo.ContentID contains a content identifier that is the same as the content identifier already on the file/directory, the call succeeds and no update takes place. Otherwise, if the call succeeds then the item's VersionInfo.ContentID replaces the existing content identifier on the file.
Flags to control updates. If the item is a dirty placeholder, full file, or tombstone, and the provider does not specify the appropriate flag(s), this routine will fail to update the placeholder.
if set to true errors may be thrown otherwise the return value may be null.
member.returns: A value that describes the reason for the failure, if any.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.ProjectedFileSystem.ClearNegativePathCache(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Purges the virtualization instance's negative path cache, if it is active.
member.param: if set to true errors may be thrown otherwise the return value may be null.
member.returns: A value that represents the number of paths that were in the cache before it was purged.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.ProjectedFileSystem.DoesNameCompare(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compares two file names and returns a value that indicates their relative collation order.
member.param: A string specifying the first name to compare.
A string specifying the second name to compare.
member.returns: A negative value indicates fileName1 is before fileName2 in collation order, zero indicates fileName1 is equal to fileName2, a positive value indicates fileName1 is after fileName2 in collation order

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.ProjectedFileSystem.DoesNameContainWildCards(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether a name contains wildcard characters.
member.param: A string to check for wildcard characters.
member.returns: true if the name contains wildcards; false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.ProjectedFileSystem.DoesFileNameMatch(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether a file name matches a search pattern.
member.param: A string of at most MAX_PATH (260) characters specifying the file name to check against pattern.
A string of at most MAX_PATH (260) characters specifying the pattern to compare against the file name.
member.returns: true if the file name matches the pattern; false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.ProjectedFileSystem.GetOnDiskFileState(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the on-disk file state for a file or directory.
member.remarks: This routine tells the caller what the ProjFS caching state is of the specified file or directory. For example, the caller can use this routine to determine whether the given item is a placeholder or full file. A running provider should be cautious if using this routine on files or directories within one of its virtualization instances, as it may cause callbacks to be invoked in the provider. Depending on the design of the provider this may lead to deadlocks.
member.param: A string specifying the full path to the file whose state is to be queried.
member.returns: A value indicating the state of an item.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ShellFolder.TryGetDisplayName(ShellBoost.Core.ShellItemIdList,ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHGDNF,System.String@)
member.summary: Gets the display name for a PIDL that may not represent an existing Shell Item. This method returns false. If you override it, make sure you also override TryParseItem, TryGetAttributes and TryGetPropertyValue in a consistent manner. Use this method if you need to disambiguate display names and parsing names, otherwise use the other TryGetDisplayName method without a SHGDNF parameter.
member.param: Options used to get the name.
member.returns: The display name or null.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ShellFolder.TryGetDisplayName(ShellBoost.Core.ShellItemIdList,System.String@)
member.summary: Gets the display name for a PIDL that may not represent an existing Shell Item. This method returns false. If you override it, make sure you also override TryParseItem, TryGetAttributes and TryGetPropertyValue in a consistent manner. Use this method if you don't need to disambiguate display names and parsing names, otherwise use the other TryGetDisplayName method with a SHGDNF parameter.
member.returns: The display name or null.

member.summary: Gets the attributes for a PIDL that may not represent an existing Shell Item. This method returns false. If you override it, make sure you also override TryParseItem, TryGetDisplayName and TryGetPropertyValue in a consistent manner.

member.summary: Enumerates the child entries of a parent entry. If the file system implementation does not support the AllChildrenEnumeration capability, the synchronizer will always use a null options, or an options with the Level property set to Children. If the file system implementation supports the AllChildrenEnumeration capability, the synchronizer will always use a non-root Parent Id with a null options, or a root Parent Id with an options with Level property set to AllChildren.
member.returns: A list of child entries.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ChunkedMemoryStream.Flush
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, clears all buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device. This implementation does nothing.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ChunkedMemoryStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between and ( + - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

member.summary: Reads a byte from the stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte, or returns -1 if at the end of the stream.
member.returns: The unsigned byte cast to an Int32, or -1 if at the end of the stream.

member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, sets the position within the current stream.
member.param: A byte offset relative to the parameter.
A value of type indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
member.returns: The new position within the current stream.

member.summary: Sets basic information of an entry using its path. If a DateTime parameter is set to DateTime.MinValue, the corresponding entry value will not be changed. DateTime parameters kind must be either Utc or Local, but not Unspecified. If the attributes parameter is set to 0, the corresponding entry value will not be changed. Note that some attributes (such as ReadOnly) should be changed using the SetAttributes method.
member.param: Specifies a combination of zero or more FileAttributes flags.

Specifies the time that the entry was last written to.
true to throw errors; otherwise false.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; otherwise false.

member.param: The new name. It can be a file name, or a full rooted path.
true to throw errors; otherwise false.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemEntry.RenameById(System.String,System.Guid,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Renames an entry using its 128-bit identifier. It can also be used to move a file if the newName parameter is set to a full file path. Note this method cannot move from a volume to another.
member.param: The new name. It can be a file name, or a full rooted path.
true to throw errors; otherwise false.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemEntry.SetBasicInformationById(System.String,System.Guid,System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.IO.FileAttributes,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets basic information of an entry using its 128-bit identifier. If a DateTime parameter is set to DateTime.MinValue, the corresponding entry value will not be changed. DateTime parameters kind must be either Utc or Local, but not Unspecified. If the attributes parameter is set to 0, the corresponding entry value will not be changed. Note that some attributes (such as ReadOnly) should be changed using the SetAttributes method.
member.param: Specifies a combination of zero or more FileAttributes flags.
Specifies the last time the entry was changed.
Specifies the time that the entry was created.
Specifies the time that the entry was last accessed.
Specifies the time that the entry was last written to.
true to throw errors; otherwise false.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemEntry.Unprotect(System.String,System.Guid,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes the ReadOnly attribute of an entry using its 128-bit identifier.
member.param: true to throw errors; otherwise false.
member.returns: true if the entry was protected and the protection was removed; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemEntry.DeleteById(System.String,System.Guid,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes an entry using its 128-bit identifier.
member.param: If set to true and the entry has the ReadOnly attribute, it will be removed before deletion.
true to throw errors; otherwise false.
member.returns: true if the entry was deleted; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemEntry.DeleteByPath(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes an entry using its path.
member.param: If set to true and the entry has the ReadOnly attribute, it will be removed before deletion.
true to throw errors; otherwise false.
member.returns: true if the entry was deleted; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemEntry.OpenById(System.String,System.Guid,System.IO.FileAccess,System.IO.FileShare,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets an entry using its 128-bit identifier.

A constant that determines how the file will be shared by processes.
true to throw errors; otherwise false.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags
member.summary: A combination of flags associated with the specified file system.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_CASE_SENSITIVE_SEARCH
member.summary: The specified volume supports case-sensitive file names.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_CASE_PRESERVED_NAMES
member.summary: The specified volume supports preserved case of file names when it places a name on disk.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_UNICODE_ON_DISK
member.summary: The specified volume supports Unicode in file names as they appear on disk.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_PERSISTENT_ACLS
member.summary: The specified volume preserves and enforces access control lists (ACL). For example, the NTFS file system preserves and enforces ACLs, and the FAT file system does not.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_FILE_COMPRESSION
member.summary: The specified volume supports file-based compression.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_VOLUME_QUOTAS
member.summary: The specified volume supports disk quotas.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_SPARSE_FILES
member.summary: The specified volume supports sparse files.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_REPARSE_POINTS
member.summary: The specified volume supports reparse points.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_REMOTE_STORAGE
member.summary: The file system supports remote storage.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_RETURNS_CLEANUP_RESULT_INFO
member.summary: On a successful cleanup operation, the file system returns information that describes additional actions taken during cleanup, such as deleting the file. File system filters can examine this information in their post-cleanup callback.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_POSIX_UNLINK_RENAME
member.summary: The file system supports POSIX-style delete and rename operations.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_VOLUME_IS_COMPRESSED
member.summary: The specified volume is a compressed volume, for example, a DoubleSpace volume.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_OBJECT_IDS
member.summary: The specified volume supports object identifiers.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_ENCRYPTION
member.summary: The specified volume supports the Encrypted File System (EFS).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_NAMED_STREAMS
member.summary: The specified volume supports named streams.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_READ_ONLY_VOLUME
member.summary: The specified volume is read-only.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SEQUENTIAL_WRITE_ONCE
member.summary: The specified volume supports a single sequential write.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_TRANSACTIONS
member.summary: The specified volume supports transactions.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_HARD_LINKS
member.summary: The specified volume supports hard links.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_EXTENDED_ATTRIBUTES
member.summary: The specified volume supports extended attributes. An extended attribute is a piece of application-specific metadata that an application can associate with a file and is not part of the file's data.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_OPEN_BY_FILE_ID
member.summary: The file system supports OpenByFileID.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_USN_JOURNAL
member.summary: The specified volume supports update sequence number (USN) journals.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_INTEGRITY_STREAMS
member.summary: The file system supports integrity streams.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_BLOCK_REFCOUNTING
member.summary: The file system supports block cloning, that is, sharing logical clusters between files on the same volume. The file system reallocates on writes to shared clusters.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_SPARSE_VDL
member.summary: The file system tracks whether each cluster of a file contains valid data (either from explicit file writes or automatic zeros) or invalid data (has not yet been written to or zeroed).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_DAX_VOLUME
member.summary: The specified volume is a direct access (DAX) volume.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_GHOSTING
member.summary: The file system supports ghosting.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ShellUtilities.ExtractMenu(System.String)
member.summary: Extracts all menu items from a shell item's context menu.
member.remarks: This method behavior depends on many contextual parameters such as the process bitness (32 or 64 bit), the type of process (Console vs Windows), or the the current thread's COM apartment state (STA vs MTA, etc.). It also depends on how dynamic context menu handlers choose to add or not menu items.
member.returns: A list of ShellMenuItem instances.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ShellUtilities.ExtractMenu(System.String,System.Action{ShellBoost.Core.ShellMenuItem,ShellBoost.Core.ShellMenuItem})
member.summary: Runs an action on all menu items from a shell item's context menu.
member.remarks: This method behavior depends on many contextual parameters such as the process bitness (32 or 64 bit), the type of process (Console vs Windows), or the the current thread's COM apartment state (STA vs MTA, etc.). It also depends on how dynamic context menu handlers choose to add or not menu items.
member.param: The action to run. First parameter is the current item's parent (which can be null for top level items), second parameter is the current item.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ShellUtilities.InvokeMenuItem(System.String,System.Func{ShellBoost.Core.ShellMenuItem,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Invokes a shell item's context menu item.
member.remarks: This method behavior depends on many contextual parameters such as the process bitness (32 or 64 bit), the type of process (Console vs Windows), or the the current thread's COM apartment state (STA vs MTA, etc.). It also depends on how dynamic context menu handlers choose to add or not menu items.
member.param: The filter that determine wich item should be invoked in the list of available items.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ShellUtilities.InvokeMenuItem(System.String,System.IntPtr,System.Func{ShellBoost.Core.ShellMenuItem,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Invokes a shell item's context menu item.
member.remarks: This method behavior depends on many contextual parameters such as the process bitness (32 or 64 bit), the type of process (Console vs Windows), or the the current thread's COM apartment state (STA vs MTA, etc.). It also depends on how dynamic context menu handlers choose to add or not menu items.
member.param: A handle to the window that is the owner of the displayed UI. Callers must specify a legitimate value that can be used as the owner window for any UI that may be displayed. Failing to specify a value when calling from a UI thread (one with windows already created) will result in reentrancy and possible bugs.
The filter that determine wich item should be invoked in the list of available items.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ShellUtilities.ExtractMenu(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Extracts a Windows menu information.
member.remarks: This method behavior depends on many contextual parameters such as the process bitness (32 or 64 bit), the type of process (Console vs Windows), or the the current thread's COM apartment state (STA vs MTA, etc.). It also depends on how dynamic context menu handlers choose to add or not menu items.
member.param: if set to true, include bitmaps
member.returns: An instance of the ShellMenuItemList type.

member.summary: Locks the shared memory associated with a Shell change notification event.

The process ID (lParam in the message callback).
The Shell change notification ID of the event that took place.
member.returns: Returns a handle to the locked memory. Pass this value to ChangeNotificationUnlock when finished.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ShellUtilities.ChangeNotificationUnlock(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Unlocks shared memory for a change notification.
member.param: A handle to the memory lock. This is the handle returned by ChangeNotificationLock when it locked the memory.
member.returns: true on success;false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ShellUtilities.ChangeNotifyDeregister(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Unregisters the client's window process from receiving ChangeNotify messages.
member.param: A value that specifies the registration ID returned by ChangeNotifyRegister.
member.returns: true if the specified client was found and removed; false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ShellUtilities.ChangeNotifyRegister(System.IntPtr,ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNE,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ChangeNotifyEntry})
member.summary: Registers a window to receive notifications from the file system or Shell, if the file system supports notifications.
member.param: A handle to the window that receives the change or notification messages.
A combination of values that indicate the type of events for which to receive notifications.
Message to be posted to the window procedure.
A list of ChangeNotifyEntry structures that contain the notifications.
member.returns: A positive integer registration ID. 0 if an error ocrurred.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler
member.summary: A Task Scheduler class that execute tasks in a queue that is dequeued by the same single thread.

member.name: E:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler.Executing
member.summary: Occurs when a task is being executed.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler.#ctor(System.Func{System.Threading.Thread,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An optional function to configure the thread before it's started. If the function returns false, the thread is not automatically started.

member.name: P:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler.LastDequeue
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates the last dequeue time.

member.name: P:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler.DequeueOnDispose
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to dequeue the remaining tasks when this instance is disposed. Dequeuing will happen on the thread callind Dispose(), not on the scheduler's thread.
member.value: A value indicating whether to dequeue the remaining tasks when this instance is disposed.

member.name: P:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler.DisposeThreadJoinTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that defines the maximum time to wait for the thread to finish when this instance is disposed.
member.value: A value that defines the maximum time to wait for the thread to finish when this instance is disposed.

member.name: P:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler.WaitTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that defines the maximum time to periodically wait for stop and dequeue events to happen.
member.value: A value that defines the maximum time to periodically wait for stop and dequeue events to happen.

member.name: P:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler.DequeueTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that defines the time to wait between dequeues.
member.value: A value that defines the time to wait between dequeues.

member.name: P:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler.QueueCount
member.summary: Gets the number of currently queued tasks.
member.value: The number of currently queued tasks.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler.ClearQueue
member.summary: Remove all tasks from the queue. Dequeuing will happen on the current thread, not on the scheduler's thread.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler.TriggerDequeue
member.summary: Executes any tasks in queue, sending a dequeue event to the thread.
member.returns: true if the dequeue event

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by this instance.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler.QueueTask(System.Threading.Tasks.Task)
member.summary: Queues a task to the scheduler.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler.GetScheduledTasks
member.summary: Gets the list of tasks in the queue.
member.returns: A list of tasks in the queue.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler.TryExecuteTaskInline(System.Threading.Tasks.Task,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines whether the provided task can be executed synchronously in this call, and if it can, executes it. This implementation always retuns false.
member.param: A Boolean denoting whether or not task has previously been queued.
member.returns: This implementation always retuns false.

member.param: The major Service Pack version number.
member.returns: true if the specified version matches, or is greater than, the version of the current Windows OS; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.CONDITION_OPERATION
member.summary: Provides a set of flags to be used in property descriptions. Wraps Windows' CONDITION_OPERATION enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.CONDITION_OPERATION.COP_IMPLICIT
member.summary: An implicit comparison between the value of the property and the value of the constant. For an unresolved condition, COP_IMPLICIT means that a user did not type an operation. In contrast, a resolved condition will always have a condition other than the COP_IMPLICIT operation.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.CONDITION_OPERATION.COP_EQUAL
member.summary: The value of the property and the value of the constant must be equal.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.CONDITION_OPERATION.COP_NOTEQUAL
member.summary: The value of the property and the value of the constant must not be equal.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.CONDITION_OPERATION.COP_LESSTHAN
member.summary: The value of the property must be less than the value of the constant.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.CONDITION_OPERATION.COP_GREATERTHAN
member.summary: The value of the property must be greater than the value of the constant.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.CONDITION_OPERATION.COP_LESSTHANOREQUAL
member.summary: The value of the property must be less than or equal to the value of the constant.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.CONDITION_OPERATION.COP_GREATERTHANOREQUAL
member.summary: The value of the property must be greater than or equal to the value of the constant.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.CONDITION_OPERATION.COP_VALUE_STARTSWITH
member.summary: The value of the property must begin with the value of the constant.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.CONDITION_OPERATION.COP_VALUE_ENDSWITH
member.summary: The value of the property must end with the value of the constant.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.CONDITION_OPERATION.COP_VALUE_CONTAINS
member.summary: The value of the property must contain the value of the constant.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.CONDITION_OPERATION.COP_VALUE_NOTCONTAINS
member.summary: The value of the property must not contain the value of the constant.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.CONDITION_OPERATION.COP_DOSWILDCARDS
member.summary: The value of the property must match the value of the constant, where '?' matches any single character and '*' matches any sequence of characters.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.CONDITION_OPERATION.COP_WORD_EQUAL
member.summary: The value of the property must contain a word that is the value of the constant.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.CONDITION_OPERATION.COP_WORD_STARTSWITH
member.summary: The value of the property must contain a word that begins with the value of the constant.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.CONDITION_OPERATION.COP_APPLICATION_SPECIFIC
member.summary: The application is free to interpret this in any suitable way.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.GETPROPERTYSTOREFLAGS
member.summary: Indicates flags that modify the property store object retrieved by methods that create a property store. Wraps Windows' GETPROPERTYSTOREFLAGS enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.GETPROPERTYSTOREFLAGS.GPS_DEFAULT
member.summary: Meaning to a calling process: Return a read-only property store that contains all properties. Slow items (offline files) are not opened. Combination with other flags: Can be overridden by other flags.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.GETPROPERTYSTOREFLAGS.GPS_HANDLERPROPERTIESONLY
member.summary: Meaning to a calling process: Include only properties directly from the property handler, which opens the file on the disk, network, or device. Meaning to a file folder: Only include properties directly from the handler. Meaning to other folders: When delegating to a file folder, pass this flag on to the file folder; do not do any multiplexing (MUX). When not delegating to a file folder, ignore this flag instead of returning a failure code. Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with GPS_TEMPORARY, GPS_FASTPROPERTIESONLY, or GPS_BESTEFFORT.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.GETPROPERTYSTOREFLAGS.GPS_READWRITE
member.summary: Meaning to a calling process: Can write properties to the item. Note: The store may contain fewer properties than a read-only store. Meaning to a file folder: ReadWrite. Meaning to other folders: ReadWrite. Note: When using default MUX, return a single unmultiplexed store because the default MUX does not support ReadWrite. Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with GPS_TEMPORARY, GPS_FASTPROPERTIESONLY, GPS_BESTEFFORT, or GPS_DELAYCREATION.Implies GPS_HANDLERPROPERTIESONLY.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.GETPROPERTYSTOREFLAGS.GPS_TEMPORARY
member.summary: Meaning to a calling process: Provides a writable store, with no initial properties, that exists for the lifetime of the Shell item instance; basically, a property bag attached to the item instance. Meaning to a file folder: Not applicable. Handled by the Shell item. Meaning to other folders: Not applicable. Handled by the Shell item. Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with any other flag. Implies GPS_READWRITE.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.GETPROPERTYSTOREFLAGS.GPS_FASTPROPERTIESONLY
member.summary: Meaning to a calling process: Provides a store that does not involve reading from the disk or network. Note: Some values may be different, or missing, compared to a store without this flag. Meaning to a file folder: Include the "innate" and "fallback" stores only. Do not load the handler. Meaning to other folders: Include only properties that are available in memory or can be computed very quickly (no properties from disk, network, or peripheral IO devices). This is normally only data sources from the IDLIST. When delegating to other folders, pass this flag on to them. Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with GPS_TEMPORARY, GPS_READWRITE, GPS_HANDLERPROPERTIESONLY, or GPS_DELAYCREATION.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.GETPROPERTYSTOREFLAGS.GPS_OPENSLOWITEM
member.summary: Meaning to a calling process: Open a slow item (offline file) if necessary. Meaning to a file folder: Retrieve a file from offline storage, if necessary. Note: Without this flag, the handler is not created for offline files. Meaning to other folders: Do not return any properties that are very slow. Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with GPS_TEMPORARY or GPS_FASTPROPERTIESONLY.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.GETPROPERTYSTOREFLAGS.GPS_DELAYCREATION
member.summary: Meaning to a calling process: Delay memory-intensive operations, such as file access, until a property is requested that requires such access. Meaning to a file folder: Do not create the handler until needed; for example, either GetCount/GetAt or GetValue, where the innate store does not satisfy the request. Note: GetValue might fail due to file access problems. Meaning to other folders: If the folder has memory-intensive properties, such as delegating to a file folder or network access, it can optimize performance by supporting IDelayedPropertyStoreFactory and splitting up its properties into a fast and a slow store. It can then use delayed MUX to recombine them. Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with GPS_TEMPORARY or GPS_READWRITE.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.GETPROPERTYSTOREFLAGS.GPS_BESTEFFORT
member.summary: Meaning to a calling process: Succeed at getting the store, even if some properties are not returned. Note: Some values may be different, or missing, compared to a store without this flag. Meaning to a file folder: Succeed and return a store, even if the handler or innate store has an error during creation. Only fail if substores fail. Meaning to other folders: Succeed on getting the store, even if some properties are not returned. Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with GPS_TEMPORARY, GPS_READWRITE, or GPS_HANDLERPROPERTIESONLY.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.GETPROPERTYSTOREFLAGS.GPS_NO_OPLOCK
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Callers should use this flag only if they are already holding an opportunistic lock (oplock) on the file because without an oplock, the bind operation cannot continue. By default, the Shell requests an oplock on a file before binding to the property handler. This flag disables the default behavior. Windows Server 2008 and Windows Vista: This flag is not available.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.GETPROPERTYSTOREFLAGS.GPS_PREFERQUERYPROPERTIES
member.summary: Windows 8 and later. Use this flag to retrieve only properties from the indexer for WDS results.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.GETPROPERTYSTOREFLAGS.GPS_EXTRINSICPROPERTIES
member.summary: Include properties from the file's secondary stream.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.GETPROPERTYSTOREFLAGS.GPS_EXTRINSICPROPERTIESONLY
member.summary: Include only properties from the file's secondary stream.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.GETPROPERTYSTOREFLAGS.GPS_VOLATILEPROPERTIES
member.summary: Include volatile properties.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.GETPROPERTYSTOREFLAGS.GPS_VOLATILEPROPERTIESONLY
member.summary: Include only volatile properties.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_AGGREGATION_TYPE
member.summary: Describes how property values are displayed when multiple items are selected. For a particular property, PROPDESC_AGGREGATION_TYPE describes how the property should be displayed when multiple items that have a value for the property are selected, such as whether the values should be summed, or averaged, or just displayed with the default "Multiple Values" string. Wraps Windows' PROPDESC_AGGREGATION_TYPE enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_AGGREGATION_TYPE.PDAT_DEFAULT
member.summary: Display the string "Multiple Values".

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_AGGREGATION_TYPE.PDAT_FIRST
member.summary: Display the first value in the selection.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_AGGREGATION_TYPE.PDAT_SUM
member.summary: Display the sum of the selected values. This flag is never returned for data types VT_LPWSTR, VT_BOOL, and VT_FILETIME.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_AGGREGATION_TYPE.PDAT_AVERAGE
member.summary: Display the numerical average of the selected values. This flag is never returned for data types VT_LPWSTR, VT_BOOL, and VT_FILETIME.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_AGGREGATION_TYPE.PDAT_DATERANGE
member.summary: Display the date range of the selected values. This flag is returned only for values of the VT_FILETIME data type.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_AGGREGATION_TYPE.PDAT_UNION
member.summary: Display a concatenated string of all the values. The order of individual values in the string is undefined. The concatenated string omits duplicate values; if a value occurs more than once, it appears only once in the concatenated string.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_AGGREGATION_TYPE.PDAT_MAX
member.summary: Display the highest of the selected values.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_AGGREGATION_TYPE.PDAT_MIN
member.summary: Display the lowest of the selected values.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_COLUMNINDEX_TYPE
member.summary: Indicates whether or how a property can be indexed. Wraps Windows' PROPDESC_COLUMNINDEX_TYPE enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_COLUMNINDEX_TYPE.PDCIT_NONE
member.summary: Never generate any index on this property.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_COLUMNINDEX_TYPE.PDCIT_ONDISK
member.summary: Always build the individual value index, but build the vector index only on demand.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_COLUMNINDEX_TYPE.PDCIT_INMEMORY
member.summary: Obsolete

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_COLUMNINDEX_TYPE.PDCIT_ONDEMAND
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Build the individual value index or vector index the first time the index is used in a query to filter, group, or sort. After being generated the first time, the index is maintained for future queries. Most property indexes should be built on demand, because building and maintaining indexes is expensive and they should be built only if they will be used.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_COLUMNINDEX_TYPE.PDCIT_ONDISKALL
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Always build both the individual value index and the vector index.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_COLUMNINDEX_TYPE.PDCIT_ONDISKVECTOR
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Always build the vector index, but build the value index only on demand.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_CONDITION_TYPE
member.summary: Describes the condition type to use when displaying the property in the query builder UI in Windows Vista, but not in Windows 7 and later. Wraps Windows' PROPDESC_CONDITION_TYPE enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_CONDITION_TYPE.PDCOT_NONE
member.summary: The default value; it means the condition type is unspecified.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_CONDITION_TYPE.PDCOT_STRING
member.summary: Use the string condition type.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_CONDITION_TYPE.PDCOT_SIZE
member.summary: Use the size condition type.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_CONDITION_TYPE.PDCOT_DATETIME
member.summary: Use the date/time condition type.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_CONDITION_TYPE.PDCOT_BOOLEAN
member.summary: Use the Boolean condition type.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_CONDITION_TYPE.PDCOT_NUMBER
member.summary: Use the number condition type.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_DISPLAYTYPE
member.summary: Indicates the display type.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_DISPLAYTYPE.PDDT_STRING
member.summary: The value is displayed as a string.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_DISPLAYTYPE.PDDT_NUMBER
member.summary: The value is displayed as an integer.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_DISPLAYTYPE.PDDT_BOOLEAN
member.summary: The value is displayed as a Boolean value.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_DISPLAYTYPE.PDDT_DATETIME
member.summary: The value is displayed as date and time.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_DISPLAYTYPE.PDDT_ENUMERATED
member.summary: The value is displayed as an enumerated type-list.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_ENUMFILTER
member.summary: Describes the filtered list of property descriptions that is returned. Wraps Windows' PROPDESC_ENUMFILTER enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_ENUMFILTER.PDEF_ALL
member.summary: The list contains all property descriptions in the system.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_ENUMFILTER.PDEF_SYSTEM
member.summary: The list contains system property descriptions only. It excludes third-party property descriptions that are registered on the computer.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_ENUMFILTER.PDEF_NONSYSTEM
member.summary: The list contains only third-party property descriptions that are registered on the computer.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_ENUMFILTER.PDEF_VIEWABLE
member.summary: The list contains only viewable properties, where <typeInfo isViewable="true">.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_ENUMFILTER.PDEF_QUERYABLE
member.summary: Deprecated in Windows 7 and later. The list contains only queryable properties, where <typeInfo isViewable="true" isQueryable="true">.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_ENUMFILTER.PDEF_INFULLTEXTQUERY
member.summary: Deprecated in Windows 7 and later. The list contains only properties to be included in full-text queries.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_ENUMFILTER.PDEF_COLUMN
member.summary: The list contains only properties that are columns.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_FORMAT_FLAGS
member.summary: Used by property description functions to indicate the format of a property string. Wraps Windows' PROPDESC_FORMAT_FLAGS enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_FORMAT_FLAGS.PDFF_DEFAULT
member.summary: Use the format settings specified in the property's .propdesc file.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_FORMAT_FLAGS.PDFF_PREFIXNAME
member.summary: Precede the value with the property's display name. If the hideLabelPrefix attribute of the labelInfo element in the property's .propinfo file is set to true, then this flag is ignored.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_FORMAT_FLAGS.PDFF_FILENAME
member.summary: Treat the string as a file name.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_FORMAT_FLAGS.PDFF_ALWAYSKB
member.summary: Byte sizes are always displayed in KB, regardless of size. This enables clean alignment of the values in the column. This flag applies only to properties that have been declared as type Integer in the displayType attribute of the displayInfo element in the property's .propinfo file. This flag overrides the numberFormat setting.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_FORMAT_FLAGS.PDFF_RESERVED_RIGHTTOLEFT
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_FORMAT_FLAGS.PDFF_SHORTTIME
member.summary: Display time as "hh:mm am/pm".

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_FORMAT_FLAGS.PDFF_LONGTIME
member.summary: Display time as "hh:mm:ss am/pm".

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_FORMAT_FLAGS.PDFF_HIDETIME
member.summary: Hide the time portion of datetime.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_FORMAT_FLAGS.PDFF_SHORTDATE
member.summary: Display date as "MM/DD/YY". For example, "03/21/04".

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_FORMAT_FLAGS.PDFF_LONGDATE
member.summary: Display date as "DayOfWeek, Month day, year". For example, "Monday, March 21, 2009".

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_FORMAT_FLAGS.PDFF_HIDEDATE
member.summary: Hide the date portion of datetime.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_FORMAT_FLAGS.PDFF_RELATIVEDATE
member.summary: Use friendly date descriptions. For example, "Yesterday".

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_FORMAT_FLAGS.PDFF_USEEDITINVITATION
member.summary: Return the invitation text if formatting failed or the value was empty. Invitation text is text displayed in a text box as a cue for the user, such as "Enter your name". Formatting can fail if the data entered is not of an expected type, such as when alpha characters have been entered in a phone-number field.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_FORMAT_FLAGS.PDFF_READONLY
member.summary: If this flag is used, the PDFF_USEEDITINVITATION flag must also be specified. When the formatting flags are PDFF_READONLY | PDFF_USEEDITINVITATION and the algorithm would have shown invitation text, a string is returned that indicates the value is "Unknown" instead of returning the invitation text.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_FORMAT_FLAGS.PDFF_NOAUTOREADINGORDER
member.summary: Do not detect reading order automatically. Useful when converting to ANSI to omit the Unicode reading order characters. However, reading order characters for some values are still returned.

member.summary: The property is not indexed.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_SEARCHINFO_FLAGS.PDSIF_ININVERTEDINDEX
member.summary: The property is in an inverted index to help speed searches.

member.summary: The property is indexed by Windows Search.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_SEARCHINFO_FLAGS.PDSIF_ISCOLUMNSPARSE
member.summary: The property is indexed to save space for properties that are not present on all files.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_SEARCHINFO_FLAGS.PDSIF_ALWAYSINCLUDE
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The property mnemonics are recognized by AQS even if the property is not a column (PDSIF_ISCOLUMN).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_SEARCHINFO_FLAGS.PDSIF_USEFORTYPEAHEAD
member.summary: Check this property for matches when looking for type ahead results.

member.summary: Defines the current sort description flags for the property, which indicate the particular wordings of sort offerings.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_SORTDESCRIPTION.PDSD_GENERAL
member.summary: Default. "Sort going up", "Sort going down".

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_SORTDESCRIPTION.PDSD_A_Z
member.summary: "A on top", "Z on top".

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_SORTDESCRIPTION.PDSD_LOWEST_HIGHEST
member.summary: "Lowest on top", "Highest on top".

member.summary: "Smallest on top", "Largest on top".

member.summary: "Oldest on top", "Newest on top".

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_TYPE_FLAGS
member.summary: Describes attributes of the typeInfo element in the property's .propdesc file. Wraps Windows' PROPDESC_TYPE_FLAGS enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_TYPE_FLAGS.PDTF_DEFAULT
member.summary: The property uses the default values for all attributes.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_TYPE_FLAGS.PDTF_MULTIPLEVALUES
member.summary: The property can have multiple values. These values are stored as a VT_VECTOR in the PROPVARIANT structure. This value is set by the multipleValues attribute of the typeInfo element in the property's .propdesc file.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_TYPE_FLAGS.PDTF_ISINNATE
member.summary: This flag indicates that a property is read-only, and cannot be written to. This value is set by the isInnate attribute of the typeInfo element in the property's .propdesc file.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_TYPE_FLAGS.PDTF_ISGROUP
member.summary: The property is a group heading. This value is set by the isGroup attribute of the typeInfo element in the property's .propdesc file.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_TYPE_FLAGS.PDTF_CANGROUPBY
member.summary: The user can group by this property. This value is set by the canGroupBy attribute of the typeInfo element in the property's .propdesc file.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_TYPE_FLAGS.PDTF_CANSTACKBY
member.summary: The user can stack by this property. This value is set by the canStackBy attribute of the typeInfo element in the property's .propdesc file.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_TYPE_FLAGS.PDTF_ISTREEPROPERTY
member.summary: This property contains a hierarchy. This value is set by the isTreeProperty attribute of the typeInfo element in the property's .propdesc file.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_TYPE_FLAGS.PDTF_INCLUDEINFULLTEXTQUERY
member.summary: Deprecated in Windows 7 and later. Include this property in any full text query that is performed. This value is set by the includeInFullTextQuery attribute of the typeInfo element in the property's .propdesc file.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_TYPE_FLAGS.PDTF_ISVIEWABLE
member.summary: This property is meant to be viewed by the user. This influences whether the property shows up in the "Choose Columns" dialog box, for example. This value is set by the isViewable attribute of the typeInfo element in the property's .propdesc file.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_TYPE_FLAGS.PDTF_ISQUERYABLE
member.summary: Deprecated in Windows 7 and later. This property is included in the list of properties that can be queried. A queryable property must also be viewable. This influences whether the property shows up in the query builder UI. This value is set by the isQueryable attribute of the typeInfo element in the property's .propdesc file.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_TYPE_FLAGS.PDTF_CANBEPURGED
member.summary: Windows Vista with Service Pack 1 (SP1) and later. Used with an innate property (that is, a value calculated from other property values) to indicate that it can be deleted. This value is used by the Remove Properties UI to determine whether to display a check box next to a property that enables that property to be selected for removal. Note that a property that is not innate can always be purged regardless of the presence or absence of this flag.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_TYPE_FLAGS.PDTF_SEARCHRAWVALUE
member.summary: The PDTF searchrawvalue

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_TYPE_FLAGS.PDTF_DONTCOERCEEMPTYSTRINGS
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The unformatted (raw) property value should be used for searching.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_TYPE_FLAGS.PDTF_ALWAYSINSUPPLEMENTALSTORE
member.summary: The PDTF alwaysinsupplementalstore

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_TYPE_FLAGS.PDTF_ISSYSTEMPROPERTY
member.summary: This property is owned by the system.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PROPDESC_TYPE_FLAGS.PDTF_MASK_ALL
member.summary: A mask used to retrieve all flags.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertySystem.UnregisterPropertySchema(System.String)
member.summary: Informs the schema subsystem of the removal of a property description schema file. This function fails with a code of E_ACCESSDENIED if the calling context does not have proper privileges, which include write access to HKLM (HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE). It is the responsibility of the calling application to obtain privileges through User Account Control (UAC) mechanisms.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertySystem.RegisterPropertySchema(System.String)
member.summary: Informs the schema subsystem of the addition of a property description schema file. This function fails with a code of E_ACCESSDENIED if the calling context does not have proper privileges, which include write access to HKLM (HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE). It is the responsibility of the calling application to obtain privileges through User Account Control (UAC) mechanisms.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType
member.summary: Defines Windows PROPVARIANT structure type tag.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_EMPTY
member.summary: A property with a type indicator of VT_EMPTY has no data associated with it; that is, the size of the value is zero.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_NULL
member.summary: This is like a pointer to NULL.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_I2
member.summary: Two bytes representing a 2-byte signed integer value.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_I4
member.summary: 4-byte signed integer value.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_R4
member.summary: 32-bit IEEE floating point value.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_R8
member.summary: 64-bit IEEE floating point value.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_CY
member.summary: 8-byte two's complement integer (scaled by 10,000). This type is commonly used for currency amounts.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_DATE
member.summary: A 64-bit floating point number representing the number of days (not seconds) since December 31, 1899. For example, January 1, 1900, is 2.0, January 2, 1900, is 3.0, and so on). This is stored in the same representation as VT_R8.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_BSTR
member.summary: Pointer to a null-terminated Unicode string. The string is immediately preceded by a DWORD representing the byte count.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_DISPATCH
member.summary: An IDispatch pointer.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_ERROR
member.summary: A 32-bit unsigned integer that contains a status code.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_BOOL
member.summary: Boolean value, a 16-bit integer that contains 0 (FALSE) or -1 (TRUE).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_VARIANT
member.summary: A variant pointer.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_UNKNOWN
member.summary: An IUnknown pointer.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_DECIMAL
member.summary: A 16-bytes DECIMAL structure.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_I1
member.summary: 1-byte signed integer.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_UI1
member.summary: 1-byte unsigned integer.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_UI2
member.summary: 2-byte unsigned integer.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_UI4
member.summary: 4-byte unsigned integer.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_I8
member.summary: 8-byte signed integer.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_UI8
member.summary: 8-byte unsigned integer.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_INT
member.summary: 4-byte signed integer value (equivalent to VT_I4).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_UINT
member.summary: 4-byte unsigned integer (equivalent to VT_UI4).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_VOID
member.summary: A C-style void.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_HRESULT
member.summary: An HRESULT value.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_PTR
member.summary: A pointer type.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_SAFEARRAY
member.summary: A safe array. Use VT_ARRAY in VARIANT.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_CARRAY
member.summary: A C-style array.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_USERDEFINED
member.summary: A user-defined type.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_LPSTR
member.summary: A pointer to a null-terminated ANSI string in the system default code page.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_LPWSTR
member.summary: A pointer to a null-terminated Unicode string in the user default locale.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_RECORD
member.summary: A user-defined type.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_INT_PTR
member.summary: A signed machine register size width.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_UINT_PTR
member.summary: An unsigned machine register size width.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_FILETIME
member.summary: 64-bit FILETIME structure as defined by Windows. It is recommended that all times be stored in Universal Coordinate Time (UTC).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_BLOB
member.summary: 32-bit integer count of bytes, followed by that many bytes of data. The byte count does not include the four bytes for the length of the count itself; an empty blob member would have a count of zero, followed by zero bytes. This is similar to the value VT_BSTR, but does not guarantee a null byte at the end of the data.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_STREAM
member.summary: A pointer to an IStream interface that represents a stream which is a sibling to the "Contents" stream.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_STORAGE
member.summary: A pointer to an IStorage interface, representing a storage object that is a sibling to the "Contents" stream.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_STREAMED_OBJECT
member.summary: As in VT_STREAM, but indicates that the stream contains a serialized object, which is a CLSID followed by initialization data for the class. The stream is a sibling to the "Contents" stream that contains the property set.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_STORED_OBJECT
member.summary: As in VT_STORAGE, but indicates that the designated IStorage contains a loadable object.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_BLOB_OBJECT
member.summary: A blob member that contains a serialized object in the same representation that would appear in VT_STREAMED_OBJECT. That is, a 32-bit integer byte count (where the byte count does not include the size of itself) which is in the format of a class identifier followed by initialization data for that class. The only significant difference between VT_BLOB_OBJECT and VT_STREAMED_OBJECT is that the former does not have the system-level storage overhead that the latter would have, and is therefore more suitable for scenarios involving numbers of small objects.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_CF
member.summary: Pointer to a CLIPDATA structure.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_CLSID
member.summary: Pointer to a class identifier (CLSID) (or other globally unique identifier (GUID)).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_VERSIONED_STREAM
member.summary: A stream with a GUID version.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_BSTR_BLOB
member.summary: For system use only.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_VECTOR
member.summary: If the type indicator is combined with VT_VECTOR by using an OR operator, the value is one of the counted array values.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_ARRAY
member.summary: If the type indicator is combined with VT_ARRAY by an OR operator, the value is a pointer to a SAFEARRAY.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsPropertySystem.PropertyType.VT_BYREF
member.summary: If the type indicator is combined with VT_BYREF by an OR operator, the value is a reference
