member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG
member.summary: Specify special retrieval options for known folders. These values supersede CSIDL values, which have parallel meanings. Maps to Windows' KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG.KF_FLAG_DEFAULT
member.summary: No flags.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG.KF_FLAG_FORCE_APP_DATA_REDIRECTION
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 10, version 1709. When called from a packaged app, LocalAppData/RoamingAppData folders are redirected to private app locations that match the paths returned from Windows.Storage.ApplicationData.Current{LocalFolder|RoamingFolder}. Other folders are redirected to subdirectories of LocalAppData. This flag is used with FOLDERID_AppDataDesktop, FOLDERID_AppDataDocuments, FOLDERID_AppDataFavorites, and FOLDERID_AppDataProgramData. It is also intended for compatibility with .NET applications, and not meant to be used directly from an application.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG.KF_FLAG_RETURN_FILTER_REDIRECTION_TARGET
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 10, version 1703. When running in a Desktop Bridge process, some file system locations are redirected to package-specific locations by the file system. This flag will cause the target of the direction to be returned for those locations. This is useful in cases where the real location within the file system needs to be known.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG.KF_FLAG_FORCE_PACKAGE_REDIRECTION
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 10, version 1703. When running inside an AppContainer process, or when providing an AppContainer token, some folders are redirected to AppContainer-specific locations within the package. This flag will force with redirection for folders that are not normally redirected for the purposes of Desktop Bridge processes, and can be used for sharing files between UWA and Desktop Bridge apps within the same package. This flag is functionally identical to KF_FLAG_FORCE_APPCONTAINER_REDIRECTION.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG.KF_FLAG_NO_PACKAGE_REDIRECTION
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 10, version 1703. When running inside a packaged process (such as a Desktop Bridge app or an AppContainer), or when providing a packaged process token, some folders are redirected to package-specific locations. This flag disables redirection on locations where it is applied, and instead returns the path that would be returned were it not running inside a packaged process. This flag is functionally identical to KF_FLAG_NO_APPCONTAINER_REDIRECTION.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG.KF_FLAG_FORCE_APPCONTAINER_REDIRECTION
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8. This flag is functionally identical to KF_FLAG_FORCE_PACKAGE_REDIRECTION, and was deprecated in Windows 10, version 1703.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG.KF_FLAG_NO_APPCONTAINER_REDIRECTION
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8. This flag is functionally identical to KF_FLAG_NO_PACKAGE_REDIRECTION and was deprecated in Windows 10, version 1703.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG.KF_FLAG_CREATE
member.summary: Forces the creation of the specified folder if that folder does not already exist. The security provisions predefined for that folder are applied. If the folder does not exist and cannot be created, the function returns a failure code and no path is returned.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG.KF_FLAG_DONT_VERIFY
member.summary: Do not verify the folder's existence before attempting to retrieve the path or IDList. If this flag is not set, an attempt is made to verify that the folder is truly present at the path. If that verification fails due to the folder being absent or inaccessible, the function returns a failure code and no path is returned. If the folder is located on a network, the function might take a longer time to execute. Setting this flag can reduce that lag time.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG.KF_FLAG_DONT_UNEXPAND
member.summary: Stores the full path in the registry without using environment strings. If this flag is not set, portions of the path may be represented by environment strings such as %USERPROFILE%. This flag can only be used with SHSetKnownFolderPath and IKnownFolder::SetPath.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG.KF_FLAG_NO_ALIAS
member.summary: Gets the true system path for the folder, free of any aliased placeholders such as %USERPROFILE%, returned by SHGetKnownFolderIDList and IKnownFolder::GetIDList. This flag has no effect on paths returned by SHGetKnownFolderPath and IKnownFolder::GetPath. By default, known folder retrieval functions and methods return the aliased path if an alias exists.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG.KF_FLAG_INIT
member.summary: Initializes the folder using its Desktop.ini settings. If the folder cannot be initialized, the function returns a failure code and no path is returned. This flag should always be combined with KF_FLAG_CREATE. If the folder is located on a network, the function might take a longer time to execute.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG.KF_FLAG_DEFAULT_PATH
member.summary: Gets the default path for a known folder. If this flag is not set, the function retrieves the currentand possibly redirectedpath of the folder. The execution of this flag includes a verification of the folder's existence unless KF_FLAG_DONT_VERIFY is set.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG.KF_FLAG_NOT_PARENT_RELATIVE
member.summary: Gets the folder's default path independent of the current location of its parent. KF_FLAG_DEFAULT_PATH must also be set.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG.KF_FLAG_SIMPLE_IDLIST
member.summary: Build a simple PIDL This value can be used when you want to retrieve the file system path but do not specify this value if you are retrieving the localized display name of the folder because it might not resolve correctly.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG.KF_FLAG_ALIAS_ONLY
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7. Return only aliased PIDLs. Do not use the file system path.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.LOCKTYPE
member.summary: Indicates the type of locking requested for the specified range of bytes Maps to Windows' LOCKTYPE enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.LOCKTYPE.LOCK_WRITE
member.summary: If this lock is granted, the specified range of bytes can be opened and read any number of times, but writing to the locked range is prohibited except for the owner that was granted this lock.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.LOCKTYPE.LOCK_EXCLUSIVE
member.summary: If this lock is granted, writing to the specified range of bytes is prohibited except by the owner that was granted this lock.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.LOCKTYPE.LOCK_ONLYONCE
member.summary: If this lock is granted, no other LOCK_ONLYONCE lock can be obtained on the range. Usually this lock type is an alias for some other lock type. Thus, specific implementations can have additional behavior associated with this lock type.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.MFS
member.summary: Defines a menu item state options.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.MFS.MFS_GRAYED
member.summary: Disables the menu item and grays it so that it cannot be selected.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.MFS.MFS_CHECKED
member.summary: Checks the menu item

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.MFS.MFS_HILITE
member.summary: Highlights the menu item.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.MFS.MFS_ENABLED
member.summary: Enables the menu item so that it can be selected. This is the default state.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.MFS.MFS_UNCHECKED
member.summary: Unchecks the menu item.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.MFS.MFS_UNHILITE
member.summary: Removes the highlight from the menu item. This is the default state.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.MFS.MFS_DEFAULT
member.summary: Specifies that the menu item is the default. A menu can contain only one default menu item, which is displayed in bold.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.MFT
member.summary: Defines a menu item type.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.MFT.MFT_STRING
member.summary: Displays the menu item using a text string.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.MFT.MFT_BITMAP
member.summary: Displays the menu item using a bitmap

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.MFT.MFT_MENUBARBREAK
member.summary: Places the menu item on a new line (for a menu bar) or in a new column (for a drop-down menu, submenu, or shortcut menu). For a drop-down menu, submenu, or shortcut menu, a vertical line separates the new column from the old.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.MFT.MFT_MENUBREAK
member.summary: Places the menu item on a new line (for a menu bar) or in a new column (for a drop-down menu, submenu, or shortcut menu). For a drop-down menu, submenu, or shortcut menu, the columns are not separated by a vertical line.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.MFT.MFT_RADIOCHECK
member.summary: Displays selected menu items using a radio-button mark instead of a check mark

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.MFT.MFT_SEPARATOR
member.summary: Specifies that the menu item is a separator. A menu item separator appears as a horizontal dividing line.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.MFT.MFT_RIGHTORDER
member.summary: Specifies that menus cascade right-to-left (the default is left-to-right). This is used to support right-to-left languages, such as Arabic and Hebrew.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.MFT.MFT_RIGHTJUSTIFY
member.summary: Right-justifies the menu item and any subsequent items. This value is valid only if the menu item is in a menu bar.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PERCEIVED
member.summary: Specifies a file's perceived type. Maps to Windows' PERCEIVED enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PERCEIVED.PERCEIVED_TYPE_CUSTOM
member.summary: The file's perceived type as defined in the registry is not a known type.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PERCEIVED.PERCEIVED_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED
member.summary: The file does not have a perceived type.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PERCEIVED.PERCEIVED_TYPE_FOLDER
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PERCEIVED.PERCEIVED_TYPE_UNKNOWN
member.summary: The file's perceived type hasn't yet been requested. This is the cached type of the object when it is created.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PERCEIVED.PERCEIVED_TYPE_TEXT
member.summary: The file's perceived type is "text".

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PERCEIVED.PERCEIVED_TYPE_IMAGE
member.summary: The file's perceived type is "image".

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PERCEIVED.PERCEIVED_TYPE_AUDIO
member.summary: The file's perceived type is "audio".

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PERCEIVED.PERCEIVED_TYPE_VIDEO
member.summary: The file's perceived type is "video".

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PERCEIVED.PERCEIVED_TYPE_COMPRESSED
member.summary: The file's perceived type is "compressed".

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PERCEIVED.PERCEIVED_TYPE_DOCUMENT
member.summary: The file's perceived type is "document".

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PERCEIVED.PERCEIVED_TYPE_SYSTEM
member.summary: The file's perceived type is "system".

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PERCEIVED.PERCEIVED_TYPE_APPLICATION
member.summary: The file's perceived type is "application".

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PERCEIVED.PERCEIVED_TYPE_GAMEMEDIA
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. The file's perceived type is "gamemedia".

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PERCEIVED.PERCEIVED_TYPE_CONTACTS
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. The file's perceived type is "contacts"

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PERCEIVEDFLAG
member.summary: Indicates the source of the perceived type information.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PERCEIVEDFLAG.PERCEIVEDFLAG_UNDEFINED
member.summary: No perceived type was found (PERCEIVED_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PERCEIVEDFLAG.PERCEIVEDFLAG_SOFTCODED
member.summary: The perceived type was determined through an association in the registry.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PERCEIVEDFLAG.PERCEIVEDFLAG_HARDCODED
member.summary: The perceived type is inherently known to Windows.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PERCEIVEDFLAG.PERCEIVEDFLAG_NATIVESUPPORT
member.summary: The perceived type was determined through a codec provided with Windows.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PERCEIVEDFLAG.PERCEIVEDFLAG_GDIPLUS
member.summary: The perceived type is supported by the GDI+ library.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PERCEIVEDFLAG.PERCEIVEDFLAG_WMSDK
member.summary: The perceived type is supported by the Windows Media SDK.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PERCEIVEDFLAG.PERCEIVEDFLAG_ZIPFOLDER
member.summary: The perceived type is supported by Windows compressed folders.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PLACEHOLDER_STATES
member.summary: Specifies the states that a placeholder file can have. Retrieve this value through the System.FilePlaceholderStatus (PKEY_FilePlaceholderStatus) property. Maps to Windows' PLACEHOLDER_STATES enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PLACEHOLDER_STATES.PS_NONE

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PLACEHOLDER_STATES.PS_MARKED_FOR_OFFLINE_AVAILABILITY

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PLACEHOLDER_STATES.PS_FULL_PRIMARY_STREAM_AVAILABLE
member.summary: The primary stream has been made fully available.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PLACEHOLDER_STATES.PS_CREATE_FILE_ACCESSIBLE
member.summary: The file is accessible through a call to the CreateFile function, without requesting the opening of reparse points.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PLACEHOLDER_STATES.PS_CLOUDFILE_PLACEHOLDER
member.summary: The file is a cloud file placeholder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PLACEHOLDER_STATES.PS_DEFAULT
member.summary: A bitmask value for default flags.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.PLACEHOLDER_STATES.PS_ALL
member.summary: A bitmask value for all valid PLACEHOLDER_STATES flags.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO
member.summary: Attributes that can be retrieved on a Shell item (file or folder) or set of Shell items. Maps to Windows' SFGAO enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_NONE
member.summary: No attribute is defined.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_CANCOPY
member.summary: The specified items can be copied.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_CANMOVE
member.summary: The specified items can be moved.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_CANLINK
member.summary: Shortcuts can be created for the specified items. This attribute has the same value as DROPEFFECT_LINK. If a namespace extension returns this attribute, a Create Shortcut entry with a default handler is added to the shortcut menu that is displayed during drag-and-drop operations. The extension can also implement its own handler for the link verb in place of the default. If the extension does so, it is responsible for creating the shortcut. A Create Shortcut item is also added to the Windows Explorer File menu and to normal shortcut menus.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_STORAGE
member.summary: The specified items can be bound to an IStorage object through IShellFolder::BindToObject.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_CANRENAME
member.summary: The specified items can be renamed. Note that this value is essentially a suggestion; not all namespace clients allow items to be renamed. However, those that do must have this attribute set.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_CANDELETE
member.summary: The specified items can be deleted.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_HASPROPSHEET
member.summary: The specified items have property sheets.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_DROPTARGET
member.summary: The specified items are drop targets.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_VALIDATE_URL
member.summary: This is specific to ShellBoost. Don't use it.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_PLACEHOLDER
member.summary: The specified items are not fully present and recalled on open or access

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_SYSTEM
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The specified items are system items.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_ENCRYPTED
member.summary: The specified items are encrypted and might require special presentation.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_ISSLOW
member.summary: Accessing the item (through IStream or other storage interfaces) is expected to be a slow operation. Applications should avoid accessing items flagged with SFGAO_ISSLOW.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_GHOSTED
member.summary: The specified items are shown as dimmed and unavailable to the user.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_LINK
member.summary: The specified items are shortcuts.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_SHARE
member.summary: The specified objects are shared.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_READONLY
member.summary: The specified items are read-only. In the case of folders, this means that new items cannot be created in those folders. This should not be confused with the behavior specified by the FILE_ATTRIBUTE_READONLY flag. FILE_ATTRIBUTE_READONLY has no meaning for Win32 file system folders.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_HIDDEN
member.summary: The item is hidden and should not be displayed unless the Show hidden files and folders option is enabled in Folder Settings.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_FILESYSANCESTOR
member.summary: The specified folders are either file system folders or contain at least one descendant (child, grandchild, or later) that is a file system (SFGAO_FILESYSTEM) folder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_FOLDER
member.summary: The specified items are folders. Some items can be flagged with both SFGAO_STREAM and SFGAO_FOLDER, such as a compressed file with a .zip file name extension. Some applications might include this flag when testing for items that are both files and containers.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_FILESYSTEM
member.summary: The specified folders or files are part of the file system (that is, they are files, directories, or root directories). The parsed names of the items can be assumed to be valid Win32 file system paths. These paths can be either UNC or drive-letter based.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_HASSUBFOLDER
member.summary: The specified folders have subfolders. The SFGAO_HASSUBFOLDER attribute is only advisory and might be returned by Shell folder implementations even if they do not contain subfolders. Note, however, that the conversefailing to return SFGAO_HASSUBFOLDERdefinitively states that the folder objects do not have subfolders. Returning SFGAO_HASSUBFOLDER is recommended whenever a significant amount of time is required to determine whether any subfolders exist. For example, the Shell always returns SFGAO_HASSUBFOLDER when a folder is located on a network drive.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_VALIDATE
member.summary: When specified as input, SFGAO_VALIDATE instructs the folder to validate that the items contained in a folder or Shell item array exist.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_REMOVABLE
member.summary: The specified items are on removable media or are themselves removable devices.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_COMPRESSED
member.summary: The specified items are compressed.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_BROWSABLE
member.summary: The specified items can be hosted inside a web browser or Windows Explorer frame.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_NONENUMERATED
member.summary: The items are nonenumerated items and should be hidden.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_NEWCONTENT
member.summary: The items contain new content, as defined by the particular application.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_STREAM
member.summary: Indicates that the item has a stream associated with it.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO.SFGAO_STORAGEANCESTOR
member.summary: Children of this item are accessible through IStream or IStorage. Those children are flagged with SFGAO_STORAGE or SFGAO_STREAM.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCIDS
member.summary: A value that specifies how Shell Items comparison should be performed.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCIDS.SHCIDS_ALLFIELDS
member.summary: Compare all the information in the item, not just the display names.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCIDS.SHCIDS_CANONICALONLY
member.summary: When comparing by name, compare the system names but not the display names. When this flag is passed, the two items are compared by whatever criteria the Shell folder determines are most efficient, as long as it implements a consistent sort function. This flag is useful when comparing for equality or when the results of the sort are not displayed to the user. This flag cannot be combined with other flags.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCIDS.SHCIDS_BITMASK
member.summary: A bitmask.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCIDS.SHCIDS_COLUMNMASK
member.summary: A bitmask for columns.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNE
member.summary: Describes the event that has occurred for a ChangeNotify event. Maps to Windows' SHChangeNotify function parameters.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNE.SHCNE_RENAMEITEM
member.summary: The name of a nonfolder item has changed. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the previous PIDL or name of the item. dwItem2 contains the new PIDL or name of the item.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNE.SHCNE_CREATE
member.summary: A nonfolder item has been created. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the item that was created. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNE.SHCNE_DELETE
member.summary: A nonfolder item has been deleted. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the item that was deleted. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNE.SHCNE_MKDIR
member.summary: A folder has been created. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the folder that was created. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNE.SHCNE_RMDIR
member.summary: A folder has been removed. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the folder that was removed. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNE.SHCNE_MEDIAINSERTED
member.summary: Storage media has been inserted into a drive. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the root of the drive that contains the new media. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNE.SHCNE_MEDIAREMOVED
member.summary: Storage media has been removed from a drive. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the root of the drive from which the media was removed. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNE.SHCNE_DRIVEREMOVED
member.summary: A drive has been removed. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the root of the drive that was removed. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNE.SHCNE_DRIVEADD
member.summary: A drive has been added. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the root of the drive that was added. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNE.SHCNE_NETSHARE
member.summary: A folder on the local computer is being shared via the network. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the folder that is being shared. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNE.SHCNE_NETUNSHARE
member.summary: A folder on the local computer is no longer being shared via the network. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the folder that is no longer being shared. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNE.SHCNE_ATTRIBUTES
member.summary: The attributes of an item or folder have changed. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the item or folder that has changed. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNE.SHCNE_UPDATEDIR
member.summary: The contents of an existing folder have changed, but the folder still exists and has not been renamed. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the folder that has changed. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL. If a folder has been created, deleted, or renamed, use SHCNE_MKDIR, SHCNE_RMDIR, or SHCNE_RENAMEFOLDER, respectively.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNE.SHCNE_UPDATEITEM
member.summary: An existing item (a folder or a nonfolder) has changed, but the item still exists and has not been renamed. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the item that has changed. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL. If a nonfolder item has been created, deleted, or renamed, use SHCNE_CREATE, SHCNE_DELETE, or SHCNE_RENAMEITEM, respectively, instead.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNE.SHCNE_SERVERDISCONNECT
member.summary: The computer has disconnected from a server. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the server from which the computer was disconnected. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNE.SHCNE_UPDATEIMAGE
member.summary: An image in the system image list has changed. SHCNF_DWORD must be specified in uFlags. dwItem2 contains the index in the system image list that has changed. dwItem1 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNE.SHCNE_DRIVEADDGUI
member.summary: Windows XP and later: Not used.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNE.SHCNE_RENAMEFOLDER
member.summary: The name of a folder has changed. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the previous PIDL or name of the folder. dwItem2 contains the new PIDL or name of the folder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNE.SHCNE_FREESPACE
member.summary: The amount of free space on a drive has changed. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the root of the drive on which the free space changed. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNE.SHCNE_EXTENDED_EVENT
member.summary: Not currently used.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNE.SHCNE_ASSOCCHANGED
member.summary: A file type association has changed. SHCNF_IDLIST must be specified in the uFlags parameter. dwItem1 and dwItem2 are not used and must be NULL. This event should also be sent for registered protocols.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNE.SHCNE_DISKEVENTS
member.summary: Specifies a combination of all of the disk event identifiers.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNE.SHCNE_GLOBALEVENTS
member.summary: Specifies a combination of all of the global event identifiers.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNE.SHCNE_ALLEVENTS
member.summary: All events have occurred.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNE.SHCNE_INTERRUPT
member.summary: The specified event occurred as a result of a system interrupt. As this value modifies other event values, it cannot be used alone.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNEE
member.summary: SHCNE_EXTENDED_EVENT extended events. These events are ordinals.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNEE.SHCNEE_ORDERCHANGED
member.summary: Pidl2 is the changed folder

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNEE.SHCNEE_MSI_CHANGE
member.summary: Pidl2 is a SHChangeProductKeyAsIDList.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNEE.SHCNEE_MSI_UNINSTALL
member.summary: pidl2 is a SHChangeProductKeyAsIDList.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNF
member.summary: Flags that, when combined bitwise with SHCNF_TYPE, indicate the meaning of the dwItem1 and dwItem2 parameters for ChangeNotify events. The uFlags parameter must be one of the following values.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNF.SHCNF_IDLIST
member.summary: dwItem1 and dwItem2 are PIDLs that represent the item(s) affected by the change. Each PIDL must be relative to the desktop folder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNF.SHCNF_PATHA
member.summary: dwItem1 and dwItem2 are the addresses of null-terminated strings of maximum length MAX_PATH that contain the full path names of the items affected by the change. Ansi version.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNF.SHCNF_PRINTERA
member.summary: dwItem1 and dwItem2 are the addresses of null-terminated strings that represent the friendly names of the printer(s) affected by the change. Ansi version

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNF.SHCNF_DWORD
member.summary: The dwItem1 and dwItem2 parameters are DWORD values.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNF.SHCNF_PATHW
member.summary: dwItem1 and dwItem2 are the addresses of null-terminated strings of maximum length MAX_PATH that contain the full path names of the items affected by the change. Unicode version.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNF.SHCNF_PRINTERW
member.summary: dwItem1 and dwItem2 are the addresses of null-terminated strings that represent the friendly names of the printer(s) affected by the change. Unicode version

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNF.SHCNF_TYPE
member.summary: The SHCNF type

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNF.SHCNF_FLUSH
member.summary: The function should not return until the notification has been delivered to all affected components. As this flag modifies other data-type flags, it cannot be used by itself.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNF.SHCNF_FLUSHNOWAIT
member.summary: The function should begin delivering notifications to all affected components but should return as soon as the notification process has begun. As this flag modifies other data-type flags, it cannot by used by itself. This flag includes SHCNF_FLUSH.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCNF.SHCNF_NOTIFYRECURSIVE
member.summary: Notify clients registered for all children.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCOLSTATE
member.summary: Describes how a property or Shell list view column should be treated. Maps to Windows' SHCOLSTATE enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCOLSTATE.SHCOLSTATE_DEFAULT
member.summary: The value is displayed according to default settings for the column.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCOLSTATE.SHCOLSTATE_TYPE_STR
member.summary: The value is displayed as a string.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCOLSTATE.SHCOLSTATE_TYPE_INT
member.summary: The value is displayed as an integer.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCOLSTATE.SHCOLSTATE_TYPE_DATE
member.summary: The value is displayed as a date/time.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCOLSTATE.SHCOLSTATE_TYPEMASK
member.summary: A mask for display type values SHCOLSTATE_TYPE_STR, SHCOLSTATE_TYPE_STR, and SHCOLSTATE_TYPE_DATE.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCOLSTATE.SHCOLSTATE_ONBYDEFAULT
member.summary: The column should be on by default in Details view.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCOLSTATE.SHCOLSTATE_SLOW
member.summary: Will be slow to compute. Perform on a background thread.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCOLSTATE.SHCOLSTATE_EXTENDED
member.summary: Provided by a handler, not the folder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCOLSTATE.SHCOLSTATE_SECONDARYUI
member.summary: Not displayed in the context menu, but is listed in the More... dialog.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCOLSTATE.SHCOLSTATE_HIDDEN
member.summary: Not displayed in the UI.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCOLSTATE.SHCOLSTATE_PREFER_VARCMP
member.summary: VarCmp produces same result as IShellFolder::CompareIDs.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCOLSTATE.SHCOLSTATE_PREFER_FMTCMP
member.summary: PSFormatForDisplay produces same result as IShellFolder::CompareIDs.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCOLSTATE.SHCOLSTATE_NOSORTBYFOLDERNESS
member.summary: Do not sort folders separately.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCOLSTATE.SHCOLSTATE_VIEWONLY
member.summary: Only displayed in the UI.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCOLSTATE.SHCOLSTATE_BATCHREAD
member.summary: Marks columns with values that should be read in a batch.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCOLSTATE.SHCOLSTATE_NO_GROUPBY
member.summary: Grouping is disabled for this column.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCOLSTATE.SHCOLSTATE_FIXED_WIDTH
member.summary: Can't resize the column

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCOLSTATE.SHCOLSTATE_NODPISCALE
member.summary: The width is the same in all dpi.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCOLSTATE.SHCOLSTATE_FIXED_RATIO
member.summary: Fixed width and height ratio.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCOLSTATE.SHCOLSTATE_DISPLAYMASK
member.summary: Filters out new display flags.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCONTF
member.summary: Determines the types of items included in an enumeration. Maps to Windows' SHCONTF enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_CHECKING_FOR_CHILDREN
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The calling application is checking for the existence of child items in the folder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_FOLDERS
member.summary: Include items that are folders in the enumeration.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_NONFOLDERS
member.summary: Include items that are not folders in the enumeration.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_INCLUDEHIDDEN
member.summary: Include hidden items in the enumeration. This does not include hidden system items. (To include hidden system items, use SHCONTF_INCLUDESUPERHIDDEN.)

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_INIT_ON_FIRST_NEXT
member.summary: No longer used; always assumed.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_NETPRINTERSRCH
member.summary: The calling application is looking for printer objects.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_SHAREABLE
member.summary: The calling application is looking for resources that can be shared.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_STORAGE
member.summary: Include items with accessible storage and their ancestors, including hidden items.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_NAVIGATION_ENUM
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Child folders should provide a navigation enumeration.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_FASTITEMS
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. The calling application is looking for resources that can be enumerated quickly.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_FLATLIST
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Enumerate items as a simple list even if the folder itself is not structured in that way.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_ENABLE_ASYNC
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. The calling application is monitoring for change notifications. This means that the enumerator does not have to return all results. Items can be reported through change notifications.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_INCLUDESUPERHIDDEN
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Include hidden system items in the enumeration. This value does not include hidden non-system items. (To include hidden non-system items, use SHCONTF_INCLUDEHIDDEN.)

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHGDNF
member.summary: Defines options used to get Shell Items names. Maps to Windows' SHGDNF enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHGDNF.SHGDN_NORMAL
member.summary: When not combined with another flag, return the parent-relative name that identifies the item, suitable for displaying to the user. This name often does not include extra information such as the file name extension and does not need to be unique. This name might include information that identifies the folder that contains the item. For instance, this flag could cause IShellFolder::GetDisplayNameOf to return the string "username (on Machine)" for a particular user's folder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHGDNF.SHGDN_INFOLDER
member.summary: The name is relative to the folder from which the request was made. This is the name display to the user when used in the context of the folder. For example, it is used in the view and in the address bar path segment for the folder. This name should not include disambiguation informationfor instance "username" instead of "username (on Machine)" for a particular user's folder. Use this flag in combinations with SHGDN_FORPARSING and SHGDN_FOREDITING.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHGDNF.SHGDN_FOREDITING
member.summary: The name is used for in-place editing when the user renames the item.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHGDNF.SHGDN_FORADDRESSBAR
member.summary: The name is displayed in an address bar combo box.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHGDNF.SHGDN_FORPARSING
member.summary: The name is used for parsing. That is, it can be passed to IShellFolder::ParseDisplayName to recover the object's PIDL. The form this name takes depends on the particular object. When SHGDN_FORPARSING is used alone, the name is relative to the desktop. When combined with SHGDN_INFOLDER, the name is relative to the folder from which the request was made.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SICHINT
member.summary: Used to determine how to compare two Shell items. Maps to Windows' SICHINTF enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SICHINT.SICHINT_DISPLAY
member.summary: This relates to the iOrder parameter of the IShellItem::Compare interface and indicates that the comparison is based on the display in a folder view.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SICHINT.SICHINT_ALLFIELDS
member.summary: Exact comparison of two instances of a Shell item.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SICHINT.SICHINT_CANONICAL
member.summary: This relates to the iOrder parameter of the IShellItem::Compare interface and indicates that the comparison is based on a canonical name.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SICHINT.SICHINT_TEST_FILESYSPATH_IF_NOT_EQUAL
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. If the Shell items are not the same, test the file system paths.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SIGDN
member.summary: Defines the form of an item's display name to get. Maps to Windows' SIGDN enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SIGDN.SIGDN_NORMALDISPLAY
member.summary: Returns the display name relative to the parent folder. In UI this name is generally ideal for display to the user.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SIGDN.SIGDN_PARENTRELATIVEPARSING
member.summary: Returns the parsing name relative to the parent folder. This name is not suitable for use in UI.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SIGDN.SIGDN_DESKTOPABSOLUTEPARSING
member.summary: Returns the parsing name relative to the desktop. This name is not suitable for use in UI.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SIGDN.SIGDN_PARENTRELATIVEEDITING
member.summary: Returns the editing name relative to the parent folder. In UI this name is suitable for display to the user.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SIGDN.SIGDN_DESKTOPABSOLUTEEDITING
member.summary: Returns the editing name relative to the desktop. In UI this name is suitable for display to the user.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SIGDN.SIGDN_FILESYSPATH
member.summary: Returns the item's file system path, if it has one. Only items that report SFGAO_FILESYSTEM have a file system path. When an item does not have a file system path, a call to IShellItem::GetDisplayName on that item will fail. In UI this name is suitable for display to the user in some cases, but note that it might not be specified for all items.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SIGDN.SIGDN_URL
member.summary: Returns the item's URL, if it has one. Some items do not have a URL, and in those cases a call to IShellItem::GetDisplayName will fail. This name is suitable for display to the user in some cases, but note that it might not be specified for all items.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SIGDN.SIGDN_PARENTRELATIVEFORADDRESSBAR
member.summary: Returns the path relative to the parent folder in a friendly format as displayed in an address bar. This name is suitable for display to the user.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SIGDN.SIGDN_PARENTRELATIVE
member.summary: Returns the path relative to the parent folder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SIGDN.SIGDN_PARENTRELATIVEFORUI
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STATSTG
member.summary: Contains statistical data about an open storage, stream, or byte-array object. Maps to Windows' STATSTG structure.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STATSTG.pwcsName
member.summary: A pointer to a NULL-terminated Unicode string that contains the name.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STATSTG.type
member.summary: Indicates the type of storage object. This is one of the values from the STGTY enumeration.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STATSTG.cbSize
member.summary: Specifies the size, in bytes, of the stream or byte array.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STATSTG.mtime
member.summary: Indicates the last modification time for this storage, stream, or byte array.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STATSTG.ctime
member.summary: Indicates the creation time for this storage, stream, or byte array.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STATSTG.atime
member.summary: Indicates the last access time for this storage, stream, or byte array.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STATSTG.grfMode
member.summary: Indicates the access mode specified when the object was opened.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STATSTG.grfLocksSupported
member.summary: Indicates the types of region locking supported by the stream or byte array. For more information about the values available, see the LOCKTYPE enumeration. This member is not used for storage objects.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STATSTG.clsid
member.summary: Indicates the class identifier for the storage object; set to CLSID_NULL for new storage objects. This member is not used for streams or byte arrays.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STATSTG.grfStateBits
member.summary: Indicates the current state bits of the storage object; that is, the value most recently set by the IStorage::SetStateBits method. This member is not valid for streams or byte arrays.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STATSTG.reserved
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STGM
member.summary: The STGM constants are flags that indicate conditions for creating and deleting the object and access modes for the object Maps to Windows' STGM Constants.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STGM.STGM_DIRECT
member.summary: Indicates that, in direct mode, each change to a storage or stream element is written as it occurs. This is the default if neither STGM_DIRECT nor STGM_TRANSACTED is specified.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STGM.STGM_TRANSACTED
member.summary: Indicates that, in transacted mode, changes are buffered and written only if an explicit commit operation is called.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STGM.STGM_SIMPLE
member.summary: Provides a faster implementation of a compound file in a limited, but frequently used, case

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STGM.STGM_READ
member.summary: Indicates that the object is read-only, meaning that modifications cannot be made.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STGM.STGM_WRITE
member.summary: Enables you to save changes to the object, but does not permit access to its data.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STGM.STGM_READWRITE
member.summary: Enables access and modification of object data.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STGM.STGM_SHARE_DENY_NONE
member.summary: Specifies that subsequent openings of the object are not denied read or write access. If no flag from the sharing group is specified, this flag is assumed.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STGM.STGM_SHARE_DENY_READ
member.summary: Prevents others from subsequently opening the object in STGM_READ mode. It is typically used on a root storage object.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STGM.STGM_SHARE_DENY_WRITE
member.summary: Prevents others from subsequently opening the object for STGM_WRITE or STGM_READWRITE access.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STGM.STGM_SHARE_EXCLUSIVE
member.summary: Prevents others from subsequently opening the object in any mode. Be aware that this value is not a simple bitwise OR operation of the STGM_SHARE_DENY_READ and STGM_SHARE_DENY_WRITE values. In transacted mode, sharing of STGM_SHARE_DENY_WRITE or STGM_SHARE_EXCLUSIVE can significantly improve performance because they do not require snapshots.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STGM.STGM_PRIORITY
member.summary: Opens the storage object with exclusive access to the most recently committed version

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STGM.STGM_DELETEONRELEASE
member.summary: Indicates that the underlying file is to be automatically destroyed when the root storage object is released.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STGM.STGM_NOSCRATCH
member.summary: Indicates that, in transacted mode, a temporary scratch file is usually used to save modifications until the Commit method is called.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STGM.STGM_CREATE
member.summary: Indicates that an existing storage object or stream should be removed before the new object replaces it. A new object is created when this flag is specified only if the existing object has been successfully removed.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STGM.STGM_CONVERT
member.summary: Creates the new object while preserving existing data in a stream named "Contents".

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STGM.STGM_FAILIFTHERE
member.summary: Causes the create operation to fail if an existing object with the specified name exists.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STGM.STGM_NOSNAPSHOT
member.summary: This flag is used when opening a storage object with STGM_TRANSACTED and without STGM_SHARE_EXCLUSIVE or STGM_SHARE_DENY_WRITE. In this case, specifying STGM_NOSNAPSHOT prevents the system-provided implementation from creating a snapshot copy of the file.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STGM.STGM_DIRECT_SWMR
member.summary: Supports direct mode for single-writer, multireader file operations.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STGTY
member.summary: The STGTY enumeration values are used in the type member of the STATSTG structure to indicate the type of the storage element. A storage element is a storage object, a stream object, or a byte-array object (LOCKBYTES). Maps to Windows' STGTY enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STGTY.STGTY_STORAGE
member.summary: Indicates that the storage element is a storage object.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STGTY.STGTY_STREAM
member.summary: Indicates that the storage element is a stream object.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STGTY.STGTY_LOCKBYTES
member.summary: Indicates that the storage element is a byte-array object.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.STGTY.STGTY_PROPERTY
member.summary: Indicates that the storage element is a property storage object.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.StorageProviderState
member.summary: Defines the possible states of a storage provider file.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.StorageProviderState.None
member.summary: Nothing.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.StorageProviderState.Sparse
member.summary: Available when online.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.StorageProviderState.InSync
member.summary: Available on this device.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.StorageProviderState.Pinned
member.summary: Always available on this device.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.StorageProviderState.PendingUpload
member.summary: Sync pending, uploading.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.StorageProviderState.PendingDownload
member.summary: Sync pending, downloading.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.StorageProviderState.Transferring
member.summary: Syncing.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.StorageProviderState.Error
member.summary: Error.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.StorageProviderState.Warning
member.summary: Warning.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.StorageProviderState.Excluded
member.summary: Excluded (not synced).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.StorageProviderState.Pending
member.summary: Sync pending.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TRANSFER_SOURCE_FLAGS
member.summary: Used by file operation methods. Maps to Windows' TRANSFER_SOURCE_FLAGS enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TRANSFER_SOURCE_FLAGS.TSF_NORMAL
member.summary: Fail if the destination already exists, unless TSF_OVERWRITE_EXIST is specified. This is a default behavior.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TRANSFER_SOURCE_FLAGS.TSF_FAIL_EXIST
member.summary: Fail if the destination already exists, unless TSF_OVERWRITE_EXIST is specified. This is a default behavior.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TRANSFER_SOURCE_FLAGS.TSF_RENAME_EXIST
member.summary: Rename with auto-name generation if the destination already exists.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TRANSFER_SOURCE_FLAGS.TSF_OVERWRITE_EXIST
member.summary: Overwrite or merge with the destination.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TRANSFER_SOURCE_FLAGS.TSF_ALLOW_DECRYPTION
member.summary: Allow creation of a decrypted destination.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TRANSFER_SOURCE_FLAGS.TSF_NO_SECURITY
member.summary: No discretionary access control list (DACL), system access control list (SACL), or owner.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TRANSFER_SOURCE_FLAGS.TSF_COPY_CREATION_TIME
member.summary: Copy the creation time as part of the copy. This can be useful for a move operation that is being used as a copy and delete operation (TSF_MOVE_AS_COPY_DELETE).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TRANSFER_SOURCE_FLAGS.TSF_COPY_WRITE_TIME
member.summary: Copy the last write time as part of the copy.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TRANSFER_SOURCE_FLAGS.TSF_USE_FULL_ACCESS
member.summary: Assign write, read, and delete permissions as share mode.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TRANSFER_SOURCE_FLAGS.TSF_DELETE_RECYCLE_IF_POSSIBLE
member.summary: Recycle on file delete, if possible.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TRANSFER_SOURCE_FLAGS.TSF_COPY_HARD_LINK
member.summary: Hard link to the desired source (not required). This avoids a normal copy operation.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TRANSFER_SOURCE_FLAGS.TSF_COPY_LOCALIZED_NAME
member.summary: Copy the localized name.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TRANSFER_SOURCE_FLAGS.TSF_MOVE_AS_COPY_DELETE
member.summary: Move as a copy and delete operation.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TRANSFER_SOURCE_FLAGS.TSF_SUSPEND_SHELLEVENTS
member.summary: Suspend Shell events.
